article.headline: UMBC 86, Morgan St. 72
article.story: BALTIMORE (AP) -- Brian Hodges scored 36 points and grabbed six rebounds and Jay Greene had 15 points and seven assists, and UMBC overcame a nine-point first half deficit to defeat Morgan State 86-72 Monday night. Hodges scored 21 of his points in the second half, where UMBC (3-3) opened with a 14-3 run and built a 50-41 lead. Morgan (0-5), which led 38-36 at intermission, eventually tied the game at 62 following a basket by Timothy Berkley with 6:05 remaining. However, Hodges, who played just 20 minutes, responded by scoring six straight points to put UMBC up for good. Mike Housman added 10 points and eight rebounds and Chris Pugh had nine points and six rebounds for UMBC, which shot 53.3 percent from the floor in the second half. Ronald Timus gave Morgan its biggest lead of the contest after he connected on a pair of free throws, which put the Bears ahead, 33-24, with 4:05 left in the first half. Timus scored seven of his 13 points in the first half for Morgan St. Guard Joseph McLean added a team-high 14 points while Jamar Smith had 13 points and seven rebounds in the loss for the Bears.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
